name: critical-thinking-extension
description: Prompts students to reflect before getting code suggestions for TypeScript tasks.

default: What is the user story or requirement in one sentence?
Define input types and the exact output (function signature, return type).
List at least 3 edge cases (empty, null/undefined, out-of-range, i18n, timezones).
What invariants or constraints must always hold?
How will you test this (unit cases, properties, error paths)?

ct.gating.mode.markdownDescription: off = no gate; soft = warn if no recent reflection; hard = require reflection before CT suggestions.

ct.gating.windowMinutes.markdownDescription: How long a reflection stays valid for the current file.

ct.llm.openaiModel.markdownDescription: OpenAI model ID to use for code alternatives aka gpt-4o-mini

ct.llm.maxContextChars.markdownDescription: Max characters of file content to send as context to the LLM.

ct.llm.apiKey.markdownDescription: Optional override for the OpenAI API key.

ct.llm.useFake.markdownDescription: Fake alternatives if true. Set to false to actually call the OpenAI API.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
